means the written record, prepared by a prescriber, of

paragraph.paragraphtext: the power of a lens to correct the refractive error of an eye, and
reading add, prisms, back vertex distance and contraindications;

definition.def: means a medical practitioner who is permitted to provide vision care services;
means, if supervision is not governed in accordance with the Optometrists Act or the Medical Practitioners Act,

paragraph.paragraphtext: in relation to the services described in section 5 (1), that a prescriber or optician supervises at reasonable intervals and provides regular inspection of the services performed by a non-registrant, and

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: a prescriber or contact lens fitter is normally on the premises, although he or she may be absent from time to time, not including holidays,

section.sectiontext: The name "College of Opticians of British Columbia" is the name of the college established under section 15 (1) of the Act for opticianry.

subsection.subsectiontext: The titles "optician" and "dispensing optician" are reserved for exclusive use by opticians.
The title "contact lens fitter" is reserved for exclusive use by contact lens fitters.
An optician may fill a prescription for eyeglasses by dispensing eyeglasses including the fitting, adjustment and adaptation required by the client.
An optician may duplicate eyeglass lenses without a prescription.
A contact lens fitter may fill a prescription by fitting and dispensing contact lenses.
No person other than an optician may

paragraph.paragraphtext: fill a prescription by dispensing eyeglasses, or
duplicate eyeglass lenses without a prescription.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subsection (1) does not apply to a person acting under the supervision of an optician or a prescriber provided that the measurements necessary for the manufacture of the eyeglasses or eyeglass lenses and the power described in the prescription are verified by the optician or prescriber at or before the time of final dispensing of the eyeglasses or eyeglass lenses.
No person other than a contact lens fitter may fill a prescription by fitting and dispensing contact lenses.
Subsection (3) does not apply to a person

paragraph.paragraphtext: filling a prescription by fitting and dispensing contact lenses under supervision,
filling a prescription by fitting and dispensing contact lenses under supervision provided that

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the person is registered in accordance with the bylaws as a student contact lens fitter, and
the contact lens fitter is immediately present at all times, or

paragraph.paragraphtext: refilling a prescription by dispensing contact lenses under the supervision of a contact lens fitter or a prescriber provided that person does not fit the contact lenses.

subsection.subsectiontext: No registrant may conduct eye examinations or refractions.
Subsection (1) does not apply to the examination required for the proper fitting of eyeglasses and contact lenses.
No registrant may alter a prescription without the express prior authorization of the prescriber.
Subsection (3) does not apply to the vertex alteration required to fill a prescription using conversion charts or similar formulae.
A registrant must offer to the client, without charge, a copy of a prescription.

section.sectiontext: The college is designated for the purposes of section 16 (2) (f) of the Act.
